question.title: Maven deploy some specify project with command
question.body:
I have a huge Maven project, the structure look like this:

ProjectA
 - SubmoduleA-api
 - SubmoduleA-server
ProjectB
 - SubmodlueB-api
 - SubmoduleB-server

Now I am using this command to deploy SubmoduleA-api:

mvn -Dmaven.test.skip=true clean deploy -pl ProjectA/ProjectA-api -p test

It works fine, but there contains 30+ projects, how to build all api module? Ignore the server module. I do not want to write the project path one by one. I have tried this way:

mvn -Dmaven.test.skip=true clean deploy -pl **/**-api -p test
